intro: Scabiosa japonica f. zuikoensis, commonly known as the Japanese Scabious, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its prolonged blooming period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
